column4: BRIEF-Reliance Steel & Aluminum Reports Q1 Earnings Per Share $2.30
column6: * Q1 EARNINGS PER SHARE VIEW $2.01 -- THOMSON REUTERS I/B/E/S
column7: * QTRLY TONS SOLD WERE AT 1.6 MILLION TONS, UP 3.6% FROM Q1 OF 2017 AND UP 10.0% FROM Q4 OF 2017
column8: * QTRLY AVERAGE SELLING PRICE PER TON SOLD UP 10.3% FROM Q1 OF 2017 AND UP 5.6% FROM Q4 OF 2017
column9: * RELIANCE STEEL & ALUMINUM - EXPERIENCED LIMITED PRE-BUYING ACTIVITY FROM CERTAIN OF CO’S CUSTOMERS DUE TO RAPID PRICE INCREASES THROUGHOUT QUARTER
column10: * ESTIMATES TONS SOLD WILL BE DOWN 1% TO UP 1% IN Q2 OF 2018 COMPARED TO Q1 OF 2018
column11: * EXPECTS ITS AVERAGE SELLING PRICE FOR Q2 TO BE UP 5% TO 8% COMPARED TO Q1 OF 2018
column12: * RELIANCE STEEL & ALUMINUM - BETTER DEMAND, LIMITED CUSTOMER PRE-BUYING DUE TO TARIFFS, NORMAL SEASONAL PATTERNS INCREASED SHIPMENTS BY 10% IN Q1
column13: * RELIANCE STEEL & ALUMINUM - IMPROVED DEMAND, LIMITED CUSTOMER PRE-BUYING DUE TO TARIFFS, NORMAL SEASONAL PATTERNS INCREASED CO’S SHIPMENTS IN Q1 VERSUS Q4
column14: * “AEROSPACE DEMAND REMAINS STRONG, AND CONTINUES TO BE ONE OF COMPANY’S TOP-PERFORMING END MARKETS”
column15: * POSITIVE PRICING AND DEMAND FUNDAMENTALS EXPERIENCED IN Q4 2017 CONTINUED THROUGH Q1 2018
column16: * RELIANCE STEEL & ALUMINUM - MAINTAINS POSITIVE OUTLOOK FOR AEROSPACE AS BUILD RATES AND BACKLOG FOR ORDERS OF COMMERCIAL PLANES CONTINUES TO IMPROVE
column17: * “METAL PRICING ENVIRONMENT REMAINED VERY STRONG THROUGHOUT QUARTER”
column18: * NON-RESIDENTIAL CONSTRUCTION DEMAND, INCLUDING INFRASTRUCTURE, CONTINUES TO STEADILY IMPROVE Source text for Eikon: Further company coverage:
